author: Special Correspondent
text:
The BJP government on Wednesday claimed to have freed more government houses from illegal occupants in the national capital than its predecessor, the UPA.

Babul Supriyo, the Minister of Housing and Poverty Alleviation, said in Lok Sabha that a total of 1,531 houses were got vacated under the provisions of Public Premises (Eviction of Unauthorised Occupants) Act during the last three years. These included 246 evictions in 2013, 539 in 2014 and 746 in 2015. He also stated that while only 10 houses of VIP stature got vacated in 2013, the number has increased to 69 in 2014.

Mr. Supriyo said that 1,207 government houses of different types were under unauthorised occupation which accounted for about 2% of the total houses under General Pool Residential Accommodation (GPRA) in Delhi.

Of the houses under unauthorised occupation, 36 cases are before the courts, 33 are with Kashmiri migrants and 27 are with journalists.
title: More govt. houses freed from illegal occupants, says Minister
